article_title: DOJ To Tailor Antitrust Actions For Health Care Market
article_text:
DOJ To Tailor Antitrust Actions For Health Care Market

Law360, New York (February 25, 2015, 1:21 PM ET) -- The U.S. Justice Department will take more proactive antitrust measures to handle the recent shifts in health care and health insurance markets, including through broad policy statements and specific antitrust business reviews, the assistant attorney general for the DOJ’s antitrust division said Wednesday.



Speaking at a two-day DOJ and Federal Trade Commission conference on health care competition, William J. Baer said the department is keeping a close eye on contracting practices and mergers among existing insurers and health care providers in light of new market and...

To view the full article, register now.
